question: 1 (c)
sols_html:
If we use the substitution

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle u=2y+y^2\end{aligned}\]

then

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle du=(2+2y)\,dy =2(1+y)\,dy\end{aligned}\]

and

\[\begin{aligned} \int_0^1 (y+1)\sqrt{2y+y^2}\, dy &= \frac12 \int_0^3 \sqrt{u}\, du\\ &= \frac12 \left[\frac23 u^{3/2}\right]_0^3\\ &= \frac13 3^{3/2} \\ &= \sqrt3.\end{aligned}\]
